newsitem.title: GREECE: ATHLETICS-KIPKETER TAKES ANOTHER STEP TOWARD 800 GOLD.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-KIPKETER TAKES ANOTHER STEP TOWARD 800 GOLD.

text.p: Dane Wilson Kipketer took another step towards the world 800 metres title with a typically individual run in the second round on Tuesday.
The defending champion was last at the bell and second to last with 300 metres to run when he accelerated through the field with loping strides to win easily.
"I don't care about any of the other competitors," he explained afterwards. "I just run my own race."
The Greek fans were delighted at the second-placed finish of Panayiotis Stroubakos who held off Kennedy Osei of Ghana to take an unexpected place in the last 16.
Olympic champion Vebjoern Rodal of Norway also went through to the semifinals after winning the third heat in 1:46.43, the same time as second placed Patrick Konchellah of Kenya.
The surprise of the round was the elimination of Arthemon Hatungimana of Burundi, silver medalist in the world's two years ago in Gothenburg. He finished fourth behind Rodal,
Konchellah and Rich Kenah of the United States but failed to qualify as one of the fastest losers.
